ygData.subject: Re: Advice
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Full Netted isn t hard to achieve. Netted is found on low-level frogloks (and is worth a few percent more than equivalent cloth in stores), and these guys
ygData.messageBody:
According to Rich Mulawa:
> give them weapons, armour, magic items and cash to be more effective
> at soloing thru the early levels. I have seen one level 7 wizard in
> full netted with a glowing crook and what I am sure are 2 +15 mana

Full Netted isn't hard to achieve. Netted is found on low-level frogloks
(and is worth a few percent more than equivalent cloth in stores), and
these guys aren't far. Even a level 7 wizard should be able to go to
Innothule or the Qeynos sewers - if he is careful - and get some.

For me, mighty high-elf wizard, netted is almost useless. Except for
the "magic" mention, it weights as much as the small pieces of clothing
(excepting: pants, girth, shawl) I can afford. For humans it is probably
more desirable.

> bracers and 2 +5 mana rings. Come on! At 9th I can't even afford all

The rest of the stuff smells strongly like twinking. I had two insigna
rings by level 7 (which I promptly lent to a monk friend, who has more use
of them than I do), but that's because you can pick a pair for a single
PP. Glowing crook? No way :)

> the useful spells through 8th level and am stuck worth a junky worn GS
> but this yahoo is walking around in 200 to 250pp worth of stuff and

At level 9, you can solo blue-conning Desert Tarantulas in North Ro.
Typical loot per tarantula: Chitin (4-5s), Spider Silk (1 out 2-3, 1g7s),
and Poison Sacs (1 out of 5, 4g5 each). I usually make a platinum per 2/3
bubble of XP. And I can reassure you, I'm alternating between the worn
great staff and the dinky tarnished dagger (to get a tarnished dagger,
find a smith, or contact a scout of Tunare - one of their quests yield
a tarnished dagger).

I am now 10, and I already have bought since I got there the 3 levels 12
spells I mainly want: Shock of Lightning, Bind Affinity, Cancel Magic.
After I've bought Resistant Skin, the cash I'll be making will go into
extra items purchase, should I find one of interest offered for sale.

Once I hit 12, I'll immediately start purchasing all level 16 spells I want,
and then resume getting cash for items.

Strong hint: Buy the spells first. Take fishing if you need to (about 1pp
in 30-40mn, but boring as hell).

--
